meanings.definition: Vestibuling (verb): to enter or exit through a vestibule.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys vestibuling into the grand building.
meanings.sent2: People often vestibule through the main entrance.
meanings.sent3: After vestibuling, he realized he forgot his umbrella.
meanings.sent4: Vestibuling into the unknown, she felt a sense of adventure.
meanings.sent5: The act of vestibuling can be both exciting and nerve-wracking.

meanings.definition: Vestibuling (noun): the act of using a vestibule.
meanings.sent1: The vestibuling of guests was smooth and organized.
meanings.sent2: During rush hour, the vestibuling at the train station gets chaotic.
meanings.sent3: His talent for vestibuling made him the perfect doorman.
meanings.sent4: The vestibuling of passengers onto the plane was swift.
meanings.sent5: The elegance of her vestibuling impressed everyone at the event.

meanings.definition: Vestibuling (adjective): relating to or characteristic of a vestibule.
meanings.sent1: The vestibuling area was beautifully decorated.
meanings.sent2: The vestibuling doors were made of sturdy oak.
meanings.sent3: She had a vestibuling sense of style that everyone admired.
meanings.sent4: The vestibuling ambiance of the hotel was welcoming.
meanings.sent5: The vestibuling design of the room added a touch of sophistication.
